name: Move to the City Online Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Change a letter from "move" to make a small animal or a spot on the skin.
questions.explanation:
Mole.

	Change the "V" in "move" to an "L" to get the word "mole".  A mole can also be a chemical measure of the amount of a substance, and it can also be a sauce!

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to make a word meaning the opposite of "win".
questions.explanation:
Lose.

	Change the "M" in "mole" to an "S", and scramble the letters to get "lose".  Lose can also mean to misplace something.

questions.text: Change a letter to make a flower with thorns.
questions.explanation:
Rose.

	Change the "L" in "lose" to an "R" to get the word "rose".  Rose can also mean a pinkish color, a wine, and got up, like he rose out of bed.

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to get a word meaning the center of an apple.
questions.explanation:
Core.

	Change the "S" in "rose" to a "C" and scramble to get the word "core".  Core means the center, like of an apple or the Earth, and it can also mean to remove the core of an apple.

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to make a word meaning a running competition.
questions.explanation:
Race.

	Change the "O" in "core" to an "A" and scramble the letters to make the word "race".  Race can also mean the color of one's skin, or a species.

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to make a word meaning a curved doorway.
questions.explanation:
Arch.

	Change the "E" in "race" to an "H" and scramble to make "arch".  An arch can also be a part of your foot.

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to make a word meaning a red, itchy patch on the skin.
questions.explanation:
Rash.

	Change the "C" in "arch" to an "S" and scramble the letters to make "rash".  Rash can also mean hasty, as in that was a rash decision.

questions.text: Change a letter to make a word meaning money.
questions.explanation:
Cash.

	Change the "R" in "rash" to a "C" to make "cash".  Cash is money, or to change a check to money (he cashed a check).

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to make a word meaning to talk.
questions.explanation:
Chat.

	Change the "S" in "cash" to a "T" and scramble to make the word "chat".  A chat can also be a birdcall, or it can be the place online where you talk.  Remember, kids, don't go on to ANY chatrooms without your parents!

questions.text: Change a letter and scramble to get a word meaning a sensation on your skin that makes you want to scratch it, like a mosquito bite.
questions.explanation:
Itch.

	Change the "A" in "chat" to an "I" and scramble to get the word "itch".  Itch can also mean eager, like you're itching to play a quiz.
